intro: Veronica clarkeana, commonly known as the Clarke's speedwell, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and clusters of small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in spring and early summer. Veronica clarkeana is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
